titles: Nevv-Englands plantation. Or, A short and true description of the commodities and discommodities of that countrey. Written by Mr. Higgeson, a reuerend diuine now there resident. Whereunto is added a letter, sent by Mr. Graues an enginere, out of New-England
author: Higginson, Francis, 1587-1630.
Graves, Thomas, enginere.
publisher: Printed by T. & R. Cotes, for Michael Sparke, dwelling at the signe of the Blew Bible in Greene Arbor in the little Old Bailey,
notes: Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
keywords: New England --  Description and travel --  To 1775.
